Text: [man] Where would you be headin', little thief?
[Geralt] I will take her, protect her,
and bring her back unharmed, I promise you that.
If I was a robber, I'd be taking their belongings, Butcher.
If I was a butcher, you'd be amongst the corpses.
I was goin' home to my family when I came upon these poor souls.
Cintran refugees. Dead at least a week.
Now they're a feast for the crows.
With the hands of two, I could move quicker.
The only thing you should do quickly is flee.
[Geralt] Come on, Roach, back to Kaer Morhen.
So Nilfgaard can have more land?
We owe it to 'em to do better.
Not a happy ever after, after all.
Let's get you out of here.
Let me take you home, girl. Something's in the air.
[Yennefer] There are, what, 60 of us? And we're the saviors of the Continent?
Well, the good news is there's only one way to move north:
We must get to the Elven keep that guards it before Nilfgaard does.
My sources say the general's moving troops to the Yaruga Valley.
If we cut them off at the choke hold,
we can still stop the Empire's progress.
We have sent word to the Northern Kingdoms.
Temeria and Kaedwen will join us to defend their lands.
We will fortify the keep until they arrive.
Does Nilfgaard really believe they can take the whole Continent?
letting loose their beliefs like an epidemic.
I saw it first hand in Nazair.
Nilfgaard take people down to their worst,
then give them something to cling to.
Because sometimes it's not shitty ale.
Sometimes it's a bed in a pigpen.
You have to make a choice to fight back.
If Nilfgaard wanted to take the North,
why would they expose themselves by sacking Cintra first?
Why wouldn't they just push through Sodden and surprise everyone?
First, she shuns the military, now she's a military expert.
First, he speaks to her as though she's not there,
and then he loses a limb.
I couldn't have said it better myself.
and you still haven't answered my question.
[Vilgefortz] If my military experience has taught me anything,
it's that the bigger picture's left for history,
which makes our task very clear:
this keep has guarded the narrowest parts of the Yaruga River.
Now it's the only thing standing between Nilfgaard and the North.
[man] These people, they have been pushed here from their homes.
the fields of corpses stretching between Gemmera and this river.
There's nothing like a higher purpose to permit men to do the unspeakable.
[man] But it's all any of us have left.
Take the children and hide before they get here.
There is no more hiding from Nilfgaard.
They have come from beyond the mountains to destroy the world.
You still believe it can be saved?
[man] One here, on the east gate.
We tried to get more fletchin', but...
Nothin' left to do but wait for 'em to attack.
I lost my farm not a sennight ago...
Took all me sucklin's, the bastards.
all on me own after me husband died.
But now I have to fight back.
I wish I could do that.
Is Vilgefortz to be our new daddy?
Do you believe King Foltest will bring the Northern armies?
His daughter was cursed. A striga.
I guess I was the only one who didn't see her as a lost cause.
I often wonder where fate took him.
You should be wary of his kind.
We should enjoy it while we can.
It's the first thing Nilfgaard will destroy.
Must you always be so fatalistic?
All the more reason to live tonight.
I've lived two or three lifetimes already.
But you haven't been satisfied in any of them.
But I've no legacy to leave behind.
It's time to accept that life has no more to give.
You still have so much left to give.
Fifty thousand of our soldiers are marching from Cintra, sir.
and when the General's forces arrive, they push through to the North.
Fringilla, tell him he cannot possibly take Temeria alone.
[Cahir] Tell him he cannot possibly understand the stakes at play.
It is one thing to destroy a few peasant insurgents,
but we cannot combat unknown magic.
Cahir, if the report from the trading post is true,
Cirilla may already be across the Yaruga.
With the General, we can take the Continent.
[boy] Where did you come from, anyway?
You tryin' to outrun the war like the rest of them? [scoffs]
Refugees have been headin' this way for weeks now.
Mum's a bleedin' heart, takin' you in.
Can't you see she's been through hell?
She's not here to take chores off your lazy hands.
If you stay, think you could teach him some manners?
We will not lose to them.
[Vilgefortz] Stay low. We don't know what other tricks they may have.
[Sabrina] It hasn't been two days yet.
How is Nilfgaard's army here already?
Doesn't matter. We can't wait for the Northern Kingdoms.
There are only 22 of us now.
Those cowards fled after tonight's attack, but I'm not goin' anywhere.
They're coming. We must move. The ten of you, to the field. Go!
Sabrina, you take the villagers to the artillery room.
[man] I don't like the look of this mist, Butcher.
You're delirious, but you're not dead.
Hey, come on now, be still, I said.
Just as soon as these poor old horses can take us there.
Don't you go to sleep now, whatever you do!
Back, you beast. I'll kill you and take your treasure.
[boy] Someday I'll make you a necklace of dragon teeth.
We must live and let live.
[woman] We have to cling to something.
[man] Grab your bows. Keep your head down.
Coral, soldiers, straight ahead. And they're moving fast.
[echoing] Hold your fire until they're in range.
[field marshal] So much for depleting them. What now?
To get to the center of it all.
I did tell you to stay out of this.
Do you know how Nilfgaard took Cintra?
Fifty Skelligen ships sunk to the bottom of the sea,
I won't let you do this.
You're worth more than Nilfgaard can ever give you.
Well, from the direction, I would say that Nilfgaard has made it to Sodden.
Take Sodden, you take the North, some say.
Take me to the Blue Mountains.
That's the other side of Sodden.
[boy] What's at the edge of the world?
If we go past it, do we fall off the world?
Hey, hey, hey. Be still, I said.
[boy] Is there food on other spheres?
And after the edge of the world,
let's go to Lyria and Rivia and Vengerberg!
[man] Geralt, I've been waiting for you.
[Yennefer echoing] Nilfgaard is gaining on us.
Get back to the keep if you can!
take the path back to us, do not stop.
[man yells] Get out of the way!
Triss! The gate! Can you buy us time?
[Triss] I don't know if I can!
I'll find Tissaia and get us help.
[woman] Come on, lads! Come on! Here!
you need to get to the front line.
More Nilfgaardians are coming to the woods.
[Fringilla] You don't need  to fight anymore.
In Nilfgaard, there are no limits.
I needed to neutralize the toxins.
But you will be all right.
You were saved by your pulse.
Four times slower than a normal man's.
But you knew that already too.
Most mages are occupied at the battle raging in Sodden,
but I heard a merchant's cry for help and...
The only thing I've ever been good at.
I'm glad our paths crossed, then.
[woman] People linked by destiny will always find each other.
People linked by destiny will always find each other.
I want you to look at me.
How do you like my eyes?
what they do to a witcher to improve his eyes?
Do you know that it doesn't always work?
You don't get to use that name.
[Visenna] No answer will give you what you want.
out of ten boys survive the trial.
you didn't know this before you left me on his doorstep?
rather than trying to find me yourself.
[Visenna] The answers will only hurt us both.
It's time to move on, Geralt.
It's time for you to find what you let go of.
You called out for so many.
[grunts] How far from your home to the battlefield?
Well, it's an hour with a swift enough horse.
You know, I'm just a simple merchant.
I can't repay you for saving my life.
But what I can offer you...
That which I have but don't know.
Just give me an ale and consider your debt paid.
No! The Northern Kingdoms are close.
[Glacella] Just because you fucked up doesn't mean we will.
[Artorius] If only Yennefer had gone to Nilfgaard.
[Tissaia] Do you actually have what it takes?
[woman] It's going to be okay, girl.
but Nilfgaard's trying to go north.
They've no reason to come here.
I was meant to find you.
We'll all be better in the morning.
The war is close, but we're okay. I need to tell you something.
An orphan,  I found her in the woods nearby.
[Renfri] The girl in the woods will be with you always.
Now, fetch him an ale before he goes to Sodden.
People linked by destiny will always find each other.
♪ The call of the White Wolf ♪
♪ The call of a stone heart ♪
♪ The song of the White Wolf ♪
♪ Bear not your eyes upon him ♪
♪ Lay not your breast against him ♪
♪ Or lips to ease his roar ♪
♪ Cast not your eyes upon him ♪
♪ Lest he kiss you with his sword ♪
♪ Lay not your heart against him ♪
♪ Or your lips to ease his roar ♪
